page.title: 03HOUSING
page.content: {Papercourt Lane} None of the houses down Polesdon, Papercourt or Tannery lanes are owned by Papercourt farm. One house, lived in by an old lady is owned by Lady Lovelace and the lady pays rent to {Housesteads Farm.}Both the houses at{ {Blunt Cottage}are privately owned, one of them being unoccupied. Down Polesdon Lane are a group of houses with{S.C.C.1920}(Surrey County Council) on their chimney breasts. After the First World War they were built for war heroes by S.C.C. when Lloyd George said,"Every man shall have a cow and an acre." The land was bought by Hall Aggregates in 1926. These houses are now privately owned. The Severn Stars public house is opposite the mobile home site and serves lunch time snacks.
